de.illonis.edulog

Class EduLog

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.illonis.edulog.EduLog

  • public final class EduLog
extends Object
    Provides logging features for Eduras?.
    For logging, Logger is used. This class handles initialization and structuration. By default, this logger supports logging to console and file.
    The logging system has to be initialized once at startup by calling init(). You may pass a filename if you do not want to use the default one ().
    Logging thresholds can be adjusted using setBasicLogLimit(Level), setConsoleLogLimit(Level) and setFileLogLimit(Level). Set one of the limits to Level.OFF to disable that logging.
    Author:
    illonis

      • init

        public static void init(String logFileName,
                        int maxSize)
                 throws IOException
        Initializes EduLog with given logfile located in the default location. By default, logging threshold is set to ALL.
        Parameters:
        logFileName - the name of the logfile.
        maxSize - the maximum size of the log file.
        Throws:
        IOException - if creation of logfile failed.

      • setBasicLogLimit

        public static void setBasicLogLimit(Level limit)
        Limits logging to prevent less severe errors from being displayed. This disables log reporting for all messages with lower severeness than given level.
        For example, if you pass Level.WARNING, messages with Level.INFO and Level.FINE will not be logged.
        Note: Setting this to a higher level than console / file logging prevents lower messages to be logged.
        Parameters:
        limit - level limit. Messages below will not be logged.

      • setFileLogLimit

        public static void setFileLogLimit(Level limit)
        Limits logging to file to given logging level.
        Parameters:
        limit - new logging threshold.

      • setConsoleLogLimit

        public static void setConsoleLogLimit(Level limit)
        Limits logging to console to given logging level.
        Parameters:
        limit - new logging threshold.

        Returns:
        the logger.
